title: stonecenterplus.com - "Secure Connection Failed" when accessing the site

milestone.title: needsdiagnosis
milestone.description: Issues in the process of being analyzed to discover the root cause of the problem. Previous stage is needstriage.

body:
**URL**: https://stonecenterplus.com/ **Browser / Version**: Firefox 66.0 **Operating System**: Windows 10 **Tested Another Browser**: Yes **Problem type**: Site is not usable **Description**: Firefox reports "SEC_ERROR_REVOKED_CERTIFICATE" on this page and refuses to load. Loads fine in Chrome **Steps to Reproduce**: Firefox claims that the certificate (or one of the certificates in the chain) is broken on this site and refuses to load it. The specific error provided is "Peer's Certificate has been revoked. Error code: SEC_ERROR_REVOKED_CERTIFICATE". I tried the same web site in Chrome, and it loaded without issue. I specifically checked the certificate in Chrome, and it said that it's a valid GoDaddy.com-issued certificate which doesn't expire until 2021.

body:
**URL**: https://www.canadapost.ca/trackweb/en#/search?searchFor=LM114954875CA **Browser / Version**: Firefox 68.0 **Operating System**: Mac OS X 10.14 **Tested Another Browser**: Yes **Problem type**: Site is not usable **Description**: When sharing a link to track a package, the "Copy" button doesn't work **Steps to Reproduce**: I opened a tracking link (LM114954875CA) then clicked the "Share" link at the top. In the dialog that opened I clicked "Copy". There were no errors in the UI, but the link wasn't copied. In the console I saw: "document.execCommand('cut'/'copy') was denied because it was not called from inside a short running user-generated event handler." I tested this an it works in Chrome 73 (latest stable)

title: eu.roadmunk.com - Only Chrome is supported

milestone.title: needsdiagnosis
milestone.description: Issues in the process of being analyzed to discover the root cause of the problem. Previous stage is needstriage.

body:
**URL**: https://eu.roadmunk.com/ **Browser / Version**: Firefox 66.0 **Operating System**: Mac OS X 10.12 **Tested Another Browser**: Yes **Problem type**: Site is not usable **Description**: Roadmunk is damaging the openness of the web - blocks all browsers except Google Chrome **Steps to Reproduce**: Opened the url in Firefox (Vivaldi,Safari,etc) none are accepted other than Google Chrome. Particularly gauling in this case is that Vivaldi is a Chromium based browser and likely supports whatever proprietary features Roadmunk felt were necessary - but they block it anyway. This sort of behaviour should be called out and the companies shamed. In the light of Edge dropping their own rendering engine in favour of becoming yet another Chromium clone the diversity of the web is at risk and we could end up with another ie6 world where Google calls all the shots. [![Screenshot Description](https://webcompat.com/uploads/2019/4/dfc78383-77cd-4221-bcc7-af39bdde689f-thumb.jpg)](https://webcompat.com/uploads/2019/4/dfc78383-77cd-4221-bcc7-af39bdde689f.jpg)

title: www.transbank.cl - see bug description

milestone.title: needsdiagnosis
milestone.description: Issues in the process of being analyzed to discover the root cause of the problem. Previous stage is needstriage.

body:
**URL**: https://www.transbank.cl/ **Browser / Version**: Firefox 66.0.2 **Operating System**: Windows 10 **Tested Another Browser**: Yes **Problem type**: Something else **Description**: Some bank's websites do not load when making online payments **Steps to Reproduce**: In Firefox, when I try making online payments with Webpay (used by many shopping websites in Chile) I get to the page where I choose my bank and, after clicking on the "Next" button, it should redirect me to my bank's website (Banco de Chile) but it just shows a blank page. This used to work properly, I noticed this issue for the first time on March 12 this year and the last time I was able to use this page was around March 2. It has worked in all browsers I tried choosing a different bank (Banco Falabella) which makes me think it's a problem between Webpay, Banco de Chile using Firefox. Banco de Chile's website seems to work well in Firefox, the problem is when trying to pay with webpay. I tried using it Edge and Opera in two different Windows PCs and both banks I tried worked well, I also tried using Firefox in two Windows PCs and in a PC that used Ubuntu and choosing Banco de Chile didn't work but Banco Falabella did. [![Screenshot Description](https://webcompat.com/uploads/2019/3/120668a2-d452-4ccf-8649-b61279516155-thumb.jpg)](https://webcompat.com/uploads/2019/3/120668a2-d452-4ccf-8649-b61279516155.jpg)
